text: "I find it easy to work with anyone," Gov Cuomo said today, appearing to have some trouble keeping a straight face.

text: Ex-Gov David Paterson said Gov Andrew Cuomo has a quality lacking in President Trump and most POTUS candidates: "I don't think too many of those candidates are in his league. They are mostly advocates. This is a man who is an administrator ... he just gets the work done"
author: GormleyAlbany

text: "I did appoint her, obviously no one thought it was a good idea, and it was a good idea."  That's not an endorsement though; Paterson now works in banking, can't endorse candidates.
author: GormleyAlbany

text: Ex-Gov David Paterson says today in Albany that he was right all along in appointing @SenGillibrand to the Senate: "I knew that she wasn't afraid to make tough decisions ... I think she is a voice from NY that is appreciated in other states'
author: GormleyAlbany

text: Gov Cuomo said in a radio interview today that when he was in his 20s and advising for his Dad, he built a fairly spartan, small office with room for a desk and some books in the governor’s mansion for his father, Gov Mario Cuomo. Now Gov Andrew Cuomo says he’s using it.
author: GormleyAlbany

text: Assembly Speaker Heastie says negotiations continue to end cash bail in most cases, to speed up trial dates and to require prosecutors to turn over more basic evidence to defense attorneys. But Heastie said ...
author: GormleyAlbany

text: Assembly Speaker says he's not worried that counties - such as Suffolk and Nassau - are opting out of the proposed legalization of marijuana. He said counties can opt out of having manufucaturing facilities, but residents would still be able to use weed for recreational use.
author: GormleyAlbany

text: Assembly Speaker Heastie said he’s not concerned about progress in the budget, which faces an April 1 deadline to sort out how to spend $175 billion along with some major policy issues including criminal justice reform
author: GormleyAlbany

text: Would be a weird PSA: Cuomo says when he was in Fla. last week he "burned like a lobster" in just 2.5 hours; "There's something to be said for the cold. It preserves you up north."
author: GormleyAlbany

text: A potentially historic power struggle is underway in Albany led by fearless freshmen legislators against 3rd term Gov Cuomo
author: GormleyAlbany
